section.p: The countryside of Shaku is an emerald patchwork of rice terraces that climb towards forests of tall palm trees where orchids glitter like fabulous jewels.

On the north coast is the city of Hagashin - a place of curious contrasts, where dingy wooden shacks cluster right up to the walls of golden palaces and verdant parks, where beggars walk the same streets as mighty lords, and where the stench of refuse mingles on the breeze with temple incense and delicate perfumes. .
